title: How to Make Your Own Beauty Products

steps.title: Create a body wash using honey, coconut oil, and castile soap.
steps.content: Create a body wash using honey, coconut oil, and castile soap. Use 3 fl oz (89 mL) of each ingredient. Stir them together in a glass or plastic container. Then, apply to a wet washcloth, pouf, or straight onto your body in the shower. Lather up, then rinse away the soap. [1] X Research source If desired, you may also add 10 to 15 drops of essential oil to give your body wash a nice scent, such as lavender, peppermint, chamomile, or orange.

steps.title: Make a body scrub with equal parts sugar and oil.
steps.content: Make a body scrub with equal parts sugar and oil. Combine 1/2 cup (120 g) of sugar and 1/2 cup (120 mL) of olive or coconut oil in a glass or plastic container. Stir to combine the ingredients. Apply the scrub to your skin in the shower and work it around to slough off dry, dead skin. Rinse thoroughly to remove the remaining scrub. [2] X Research source Add 1/2 tsp (2.5 mL) of vanilla extract to give your body scrub a pleasant scent. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Mix up some body oil using olive oil.
steps.content: Mix up some body oil using olive oil. Making your own lotion is a great way to ensure that only natural ingredients go into it, but if you don’t have the time or ingredients, just use olive as a lotion! [4] X Research source The best herbs for making lotions at home are chamomile and calendula. They can help with dry skin and promote anti-aging. [5] X Research source You can use essential oils like rosemary and tea tree oil which have anti-inflammatory qualities. [6] X Research source Cedarwood essential oil reduces irritation, ylang-ylang is an effective cleanser, and pomegranate seed oil has anti-aging properties. [7] X Research source Try adding a few drops of peppermint, lavender, lemon, or clary sage essential oil to give the oil a nice scent.

steps.title: Whip up a facial mask using ingredients in your kitchen.
steps.content: Whip up a facial mask using ingredients in your kitchen. Facial masks come in many different varieties. You can make a facial mask using food from your kitchen and achieve the same results as a pre-made mask you’d find in a beauty supply store. [8] X Research source Combine 1/2 of an avocado, 1 tbsp (15 mL) of yogurt, and 1 tbsp (15 mL) of honey for a moisturizing mask. Whisk egg whites with orange juice and turmeric for a pore-minimizing mask. Mix honey with cinnamon and lemon for a calming face mask. Stir raw oats into honey and mashed banana for a redness-reducing mask.

steps.title: Create a simple shampoo using equal parts castile soap and water.
steps.content: Create a simple shampoo using equal parts castile soap and water. Pour 4 fl oz (120 mL) of castile soap and 4 fl oz (120 mL) of water into a plastic or glass container. Then, stir the soap and water together gently to combine them. Wet your hair and apply a quarter-sized amount (about 15 mL) to your hair. Work it in with your fingertips and then rinse it away. [9] X Research source Mix in 1 tbsp (15 mL) of olive oil for a moisturizing shampoo. Add 2 to 3 drops of essential oil to create a scented shampoo.

steps.title: Mix up your own conditioner using ingredients from your kitchen.
steps.content: Mix up your own conditioner using ingredients from your kitchen. Mix 1 mashed banana or avocado, or 4 fl oz (120 mL) of plain, whole-milk yogurt with 1 tsp (5 mL) of coconut or olive oil, and 1 tsp (5 mL) of honey. Apply the conditioner to your hair after you shampoo it. Let it sit for about 3 minutes, then rinse your hair thoroughly to get all of the conditioners out. [10] X Research source Keep in mind that this mixture won’t keep at room temperature. Put it in an air-tight container and store it in the fridge for up to 1 week. If you want something you can spritz into your hair to help detangle it, make a leave-in conditioner.

steps.title: Combine gelatin and water for a natural hairspray.
steps.content: Combine gelatin and water for a natural hairspray. Add 1 tsp (5 g) of gelatin to 8 fl oz (240 mL) of hot water. Stir the gelatin into the water until it dissolves. Let the water cool, and then transfer the gelatin hairspray to a spray bottle. Spritz it onto wet or dry hair as needed. [11] X Research source You can store the hairspray at room temperature for about 6 months, but shake it before each use as the gelatin may separate from the water.

steps.title: Make hair gel out of aloe vera gel.
steps.content: Make hair gel out of aloe vera gel. Purchase pure aloe vera gel from a store, and measure out 1/2 cup (120 mL). Mix in about 20 drops of essential oil if desired to add scent to the hair gel. [12] X Research source Store the hair gel in an air-tight container and keep it at room temperature for up to 3 months.

steps.title: Combine beeswax, coconut oil, and cocoa butter for lip balm.
steps.content: Combine beeswax, coconut oil, and cocoa butter for lip balm. Combine 1/4 cup (60 g) of grated beeswax, 2 tbsp (30 mL) of cocoa butter, 3 tbsp (45 mL) of coconut oil, and 1 tbsp (15 mL) of almond oil in a glass or plastic container. Melt the ingredients by microwaving them for 15 seconds at a time and stirring. [13] X Research source Transfer the lip balm to small containers or lip balm pots while it is still warm and let it cool. The lip balm will become solid when it is cool. Apply to your lips as needed.

steps.title: Make eye shadow using eye shadow pigments.
steps.content: Make eye shadow using eye shadow pigments. You can purchase eye shadow pigments online and combine different colors to create custom eye shadows. Keep the powder loose, or mix about 1 tsp (5 g) of pigment with a few drops of isopropyl alcohol to form a paste that you can transfer to an eye shadow pan. Press the paste with a paper towel to remove the excess liquid. [14] X Research source Make sure that the pigments you use to make eyeshadow are safe for eye makeup!

steps.title: Create your own mascara.
steps.content: Create your own mascara. Making your own mascara is easy with a few special ingredients! Combine 2 tsp (10 mL) of coconut oil, 4 tsp (20 mL) of pure aloe vera, and 1 tsp (5 g) of grated beeswax in a small pan. Melt the ingredients over low heat on your stove, then remove them from the heat. Then, add about 1/2 tsp (2.5 g) of activated charcoal or cocoa powder to the mixture and stir to combine them. Transfer the liquid to a clean mascara tube. [15] X Research source Charcoal will make your mascara black, while cocoa powder will make it brown.
